item.title: Antiparasitic peptides discovery
item.description: I have contributed to this project as part of my work as research assistant at the Applied Signal Processing and Machine Learning Research Group - Universidad San Francisco de Quito, in Ecuador. Summary Antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) are small bioactive compounds, commonly with fewer than 50 amino acids, that have appeared as promising compounds to treat a wide range of diseases such as infections caused by multidrug-resistant bacteria, chronic inflammatory diseases, and some types of cancer.
